title.narrative: Integration of health services and ecological sustainability for community resilience in Myanmar

description.narrative: Myanmar is facing a double crisis due to the military coup in February 2021 and the COVID-19 pandemic. The public services including the health system, supply chains for food, and other essential supplies are collapsing and widespread armed conflict, impacting the lives of people living in urban areas as well as remote rural villages. There have been escalating displacements caused by airstrikes and armed clashes between the Myanmar Armed Forces and Ethnic Armed Groups and various PDFs in multiple states and regions. The security and humanitarian situation in Myanmar remains volatile and a multi-dimensional humanitarian crisis is now affecting the whole country, posing grave protection risks for civilians, limiting access to services, and deepening food insecurity (also as a result of climate change). Based on the existing capacity and experiences, the ECHPC with support of KMSS NO is aiming to strengthen all diocesan commissions to be able to respond to the ongoing crisis in Myanmar as well as to build resilient adaptation for food security. Through this project there will be three main approaches: a) capacity building on key stakeholders for technical implementation as well as thematic awareness; b) Accompaniment and support for crisis response and fostering community resilience; c) community level action for awareness and need response. This project aligns with the Myanmar church strategy to respond to current crisis and build sustainability for communities in need.
